text: The 2009 European Junior Badminton Championships were held in Federal Technical Centre - Palabadminton, Milan, Italy, between April 3 and April 15, 2009. ==Medalists== {| |- |rowspan=2|Men's singles |rowspan=2| Emil Holst |rowspan=2| Jamie Van Hooijdonk | Kasper Lehikoinen |- | Steffen Rasmussen |- |rowspan=2|Women's singles |rowspan=2| Anne Hald |rowspan=2| Carolina Marín | Natalia Perminova |- | Lianne Tan |- |rowspan=2|Men's doubles |rowspan=2| Sylvain Grosjean and Sam Magee |rowspan=2| Emil Holst and Mads Pedersen | Niclas Nohr and Steffen Rasmussen |- | Jonas Geigenberger and Andreas Heinz |- |rowspan=2|Women's doubles |rowspan=2| Anastasia Chervyakova and Romina Gabdullina |rowspan=2| Selena Piek and Iris Tabeling | Elena Komendrovskaya and Ksenia Polikarpova |- | Jessica Fletcher and Sarah Milne |- |rowspan=2|Mixed doubles |rowspan=2| Jacco Arends and Selena Piek |rowspan=2| Jonas Geigenberger and Fabienne Deprez | Morten Bodskov and Sara Thygesen |- | Ben Stawski and Lauren Smith |- | rowspan=2 |Teams | rowspan=2 | | rowspan=2 | | |- | |} == References == ==External links== *bwf.tournamentsoftware.com: European Junior Championships 2009 *bwf.tournamentsoftware.com: European Junior Team Championships 2009 2009 European Junior Badminton Championships Category:Badminton tournaments in Italy Category:2007 in Italian sport
title: 2009 European Junior Badminton Championships
